metadata.title: The Profitability of Cryptocurrency Forecasting using Neural Networks | by Thanasis Zoumpekas | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: The Profitability of Cryptocurrency Forecasting using Neural Networks

all_paragraphs: The cryptocurrency markets have been rapidly established and their instability presents significant research challenges and requires rigorous examination of their behaviour [1, 2]. Nowadays, cryptocurrencies have gained a significant place in the daily lives of people in the investment sector and market practitioners [3].

This writing presents a decision support system on forecasting and trading cryptocurrencies and attempts to provide a naive profitability analysis of a previously developed such system utilizing deep learning. In particular, deep learning algorithms are used to predict the closing price of the Ethereum cryptocurrency in a short period.

The data are collected from Poloniex exchange (ETH/USD time series) and analyzed through a Long Short Term Memory network. This deep learning model is distinguished after rigorous benchmarks and performance evaluation under various metrics between other models in a previous study. The experimentation suggests that the above-mentioned model can be utilized to predict the Ethereum closing price in real-time, in a scientifically interesting manner and with promising accuracy.

Below, naive profitability analysis of the forecasting system is displayed. To evaluate the effectiveness of the predictions three time-frames are randomly selected. A downward period, an upward period and a period containing both of them are distinguished. The downward period contains the time series data from July 26, 2018, to August 13 2018. The upward period contains the time series data from June 09 2019 to June 23 2019. The mixed period contains the time series data from July 13, 2019, to September 20 2019.

By developing a trading simulation, the profit of trading using the forecasting system, i.e. active trading, versus the passive trading strategy, namely buy and hold is tested. Buy and hold is a simple investment strategy where an individual buys stocks/cryptocurrency coins and holds them for a long time, with the goal that they will gradually increase in value over a long period [4].

Two agents are considered, the one using the active trading strategy (a) and the one using the buy and hold strategy (b). Each of them starts with a capital of 1000$. Agent b buys coins at the price of the beginning of each time-frame spending all his money. He sells all the bought coins at the price at the end of the time-frame. Agent a buys and sells coins with decisions based on its forecasting system. He buys or sells crypto-coins according to a prediction of the implemented algorithm for the next 5 minutes every 30 minutes. This naive approach is based on the following flowchart:

Agent a has done 292 transactions in total and now he owns 732.36$. His profit using active trading is negative -267.64$. Agent b, using the naive buy and hold strategy, has done 2 transactions, one in the beginning and one at the end of the period, and now he owns 608.55$. His profit is negative -391.45$ and lower by 123.81$ than the agent’s a.

Agent a has done 1429 transactions in total and now he owns 1088.95$. His profit using active trading is 88.95$. Agent b, using the naive buy and hold strategy, has done 2 transactions and now he owns 801.53$. His profit is negative -198.47$ and by far lower than the agent’s a.

A prototype real-time “trading” simulation system utilizing the forecasting of the pre-trained and loaded LSTM neural network is running on Heroku. Please feel free to collaborate and/or give recommendations. Surely, the expert market practitioners truly know the advantages and disadvantages of such systems.

This study provides by no means a complete actual forecasting profitable cryptocurrency system. However, it is scientific experimentation and still needs to be calibrated with more exogenous data from social media and/or other sources rather than actual price data. The profitability analysis of this system should also take into consideration the transaction fees of the utilized exchange platform. And last but not least, the above study presents a decision support system rather than a system that you should follow completely blindly. Well, even if in the finance world, the individuals say that the “past performance is not an indicator for future outcomes”, this should not stop someone to develop and experiment on such models and systems.
